Hogan began his professional wrestling career in 1976 after being spotted by a local wrestling promoter, Ray Stevens, and eventually made his debut for Georgia Championship Wrestling. His charismatic personality and powerful physique quickly made him a fan favorite.

In 1980, Hogan joined the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), now known as WWE, under the leadership of the influential promoter, Vince McMahon. He soon became the face of WWF and rose to fame as the main attraction of the organization, with the creation of the "Hulkamania" fandom. As part of his larger-than-life persona, Hogan adopted the "Hulkster" nickname, and his signature moves, including the Flying Elbow Drop and the Leg Drop, became a staple in professional wrestling.

Hogan's most iconic rivalry was with fellow wrestler Randy "Macho Man" Savage, culminating in the infamous "Montreal Screwjob" at the 1997 Survivor Series pay-per-view event, where he was reportedly betrayed and stripped of his WWF title.

Throughout his WWF tenure, Hogan held numerous championships, including WWF World Heavyweight Championship, WWF Intercontinental Heavyweight Championship, and WWF Tag Team Championship.

Beyond wrestling, Hogan ventured into the world of entertainment, starring in films such as "No Holds Barred" (1989), "Thunder in Paradise" (1994), "Universal Soldier" (1992), and "Hulkamania: When Heaven and Hell Collide" (2009). In 2016, he made a comeback in WWE, joining the Raw brand under a new persona called "Hulk Hogan's Fan favorites," before later reverting to the Hulk Hog

Known for his larger-than-life persona, Hogan played a pivotal role in shaping the world of professional wrestling as we know it today, popularizing the concept of the "heel" and "face" wrestlers.

Early Life:
Hogan grew up in a working-class family and had a passion for wrestling from a young age. He attended Georgia State University on a wrestling scholarship before transferring to the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. It was during his college years that Hogan began his professional wrestling career.

Professional Wrestling Career (1976-1991):
In 1976, Hogan made his professional wrestling debut for World Wide Wrestling Federation (WWWF), later known as World Wrestling Federation (WWF). He soon became the "Million Dollar Man" and a leading figure in the tag-team division. Over the years, Hogan went on to achieve numerous championships in various promotions, including the WWF, National Wrestling Alliance (NWA), and World Championship Wrestling (WCW).

In 1984, Hogan was propelled to global fame with the release of the film "Rocky IV," where he played the role of wrestling icon Ivan Drago. This led to his characterization as "The Hollywood Hulk Hogan" in the wrestling world.

In 1985, Hogan began his most memorable character as "Hulkamaniacs' Champion," a combination of the "Hulk" persona and the famous "Superstars" catchphrase. He held the WWF World Heavyweight Championship numerous times and became a household name in the 1980s. His rivalry with Mr. T and his feud with André the Giant became iconic in wrestling history.

Hogan's success in the wrestling industry led to the establishment of WrestleMania, an annual championship event that became synonymous with the WWF.

During his tenure at the WWF (now WWE), Hogan held the WWF World Heavyweight Championship a record seven times, from 1984 to 1997. He had legendary rivalries with other wrestling icons such as "Macho Man" Randy Savage, Andre the Giant, and "Rowdy" Roddy Piper. Hogan's biggest rivalry came with "Macho Man" Randy Savage, leading to an epic series of matches and storylines that cemented the popularity of professional wrestling in the 1980s.
subject: Hulk Hogan
intro: Hulk Hogan, born Terry Gene Bollea, is a renowned retired American professional wrestler.
